parameters.description: The test assembly the collection belongs to
The optional type which contains the collection definition
A flag to indicate whether this test collection opts out of parallelization
The display name for the test collection
The unique ID for the test collection (only used to override default behavior in testing scenarios)

children.summary: Gets the s attached to the test collection (and the test assembly).

content.value: Public ReadOnly Property ClassFixtureTypes As IReadOnlyCollection(Of Type)

children.summary: Gets a list of collection fixture types associated with the test collection.

children.remarks: This should only be used to execute a test collection. All reflection should be abstracted here instead for better testability.
children.summary: Gets the type that this collection definition derived from, if it derives from one. Untyped collections are possible when test classes are decorated using and there is no test collection class declared with the same name.

content.value: Public ReadOnly Property CollectionFixtureTypes As IReadOnlyCollection(Of Type)

children.summary: Gets a list of collection fixture types associated with the test collection.

parameters.description: The info to get the object data from

children.summary: Called when the object should populate itself with data from the serialization info.
Determines whether tests in this collection runs in parallel with any other collections.

parameters.description: The info to store the object data into

children.summary: Called when the object should store its serialized values into the serialization info.

content.value: Public ReadOnly Property TestAssembly As IXunitTestAssembly

children.summary: Gets the test assembly this test collection belongs to.

content.value: Public ReadOnly Property TestCaseOrderer As ITestCaseOrderer

children.summary: Gets the test case orderer for the test collection, if present.

content.value: Public ReadOnly Property TestCollectionClassName As String

children.summary: Gets the type that the test collection was defined with, if available; may be null if the test collection didn't have a definition type.

content.value: Public ReadOnly Property TestCollectionDisplayName As String

children.summary: Gets the display name of the test collection.

content.value: Public ReadOnly Property Traits As IReadOnlyDictionary(Of String, IReadOnlyCollection(Of String))

children.summary: Gets the trait values associated with this test collection (and the test assembly). If there are none, or the framework does not support traits, this returns an empty dictionary (not null).

content.value: Public ReadOnly Property UniqueID As String

children.remarks: The unique identifier for a test collection should be able to discriminate among test collections in the same test assembly. This identifier should remain stable until such time as the developer changes some fundamental part of the identity (the test assembly, the collection definition class, or the collection name). Recompilation of the test assembly is reasonable as a stability changing event.
children.summary: Gets the unique ID for this test collection.

summary: The default implementation of for xUnit.net v3.
